Home
WebAPI (v2 Beta)
API Overview
Please note: version 2 is in betatest mode, changes may be made at any time on this version of the API without notice.

Our API allows you to get all of ScreenScraper's data and media to integrate it into your applications: front-ends, utilities. All our requests allow us to obtain the desired information in XML, JSON or ini format.

Who can use the API?
The ScreenScraper API can only be integrated into completely free and distributed applications, or, otherwise, with the prior authorization and conditions dictated by the ScreenScraper team. Any breach of this rule may result in account being cut off or even possible legal proceedings!
If you are a developer and want to integrate our API, contact us via the forum to present your software and obtain your username and password to provide to the API to validate your rights to use it.


Requests for information and/or media to the ScreenScraper API are made by calling GET URL requests and an XML or json document is returned. Example Game Search: https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/jeuInfos.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&ssid=test&sspassword=test&output=xml&crc=50ABC90A&systemeid=1&romtype=rom&romnom=Sonic%20The%20Hedgehog%202%20(World).zip&romtaille=749652
How many concurrent requests to the API is allowed?
Depending on the level of contribution of the user (to the database or financial), he is assigned "Threads" openings.

What is a "Thread"?
Some scraping software, such as "Universal XML Scraper" allows you to save 'scrape time' by not processing the roms one by one, but simultaneously in parallel.
The number of simultaneous scrapes is what is called a "Thread".
So with 4 Threads, you scrape your roms 4 by 4, which is a huge time saver.
On the other hand, it puts much more strain on your computer and your bandwidth (so it must have the necessary resources) but above all, it puts much more strain on the database and the server that hosts it.
This is why the "reward" system was put in place. To thank you for contributing to the life of the Screenscraper database, we offer you the opportunity to draw on its resources more efficiently.


How do I earn threads?
There are 2 simple methods:
- Participate in the database by proposing new information or new media
- Participate financially in the hosting of the database via Tipee or Patreon.


How many Threads can I earn?
Consult the F.A.Q for more information
How many requests is the API allowed per minute per day?
Since about the middle of 2019, a "Quota" system has been integrated into the API in order to avoid saturation of our servers.

The principle is to limit the right to access the API for each user per minute and per day according to their level and their financial participation.

Consult the F.A.Q for more information

The "Quota" information is returned in the user data so that it can be easily integrated and managed directly by the scrape software.
This management of "Quota" by software is now mandatory so as not to saturate our servers for nothing.
Error feedback
API requests return HTTP error numbers if something goes wrong. Here they are:

Error Description Cause
400 Problem with the URL API call URL contains no information
400 Mandatory fields are missing from the url One of the required minimum fields is missing from the API call URL
400 Error in the name of the rom file: it contains a path The name of the ROM file sent is of type "!mnt!sda1!batocera!roms..."
400 Wrong crc, md5 or sha1 field The crc, md5, or sha1 field is not formatted correctly
400 Problem in the name of the rom file The name of the rom file is not compliant
401 Closed API for non-members or inactive members The server is saturated (CPU usage>60%)
403 Login error: Verify your developer credentials! Eroded Developer IDs
404 Error: Game not found! / Error: Rom/Iso/Folder not found! Unable to find a match on the requested rom
423 Fully closed API The Server has a serious problem
426 The scrape software used has been blacklisted (non-compliant / outdated version) You have to change the software version
429 The number of threads allowed for the member is reached You need to reduce the speed of requests
429 The number of threads per minute allowed for the member is reached You need to reduce the speed of requests
429 The maximum threads allowed to leecher users is already used You need to reduce the speed of requests
429 The maximum threads is already used You need to reduce the speed of requests
430 Your scrape quota has passed for today! The member has scraped more than x (see F.A.Q) roms in the day
431 Sort through your rom files and come back tomorrow! The member has scraped more than x (see F.A.Q) roms not recognized by ScreenScraper
List of requests
ssinfraInfos.php: ScreenScraper
Framework Information ssuserInfos.php: ScreenScraper
User Information userlevelsListe.php: ScreenScraper
User Level List nbJoueursListe.php: Player Count
List supportTypesListe.php: Media
Type List romTypesListe.php: Rom Type
ListregionsListe.php: List of languesListe.php regions
: List of genresListe.php languages
: List of famillesListe.php genres
: List of classificationsListe.php families
: List of Classifications (Game Rating)
mediasSystemeListe.php: List of media for mediasJeuListe.php systems
: List of media for games
infosJeuListe.php: Info list for infosRomListe.php games
: Info list for roms
mediaGroup.php: Download media images for game
groups mediaCompagnie.php: Download media images for game
groups systemesListe.php: List of systems / system information / system
media informationmediaSysteme.php: Downloading media images from mediaVideoSysteme.php systems
: Downloading video media from jeuRecherche.php systems
: Searching for a game with its name (returns a table of games (limited to 30 games) ranked by probability)
jeuInfos.php: Information about a game / Media from a game
mediaJeu.php: Downloading media images from games
mediaVideoJeu.php: Downloading video media of games
mediaManuelJeu.php: Downloading game manuals
botNote.php: System for automating the sending of a game note from a ScreenScraper
member botProposition.php: System for automating the sending of news or media proposals to ScreenScraper
ssinfraInfos.php: ScreenScraper Framework Information
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your password developer
softname: name of the software calling
output: xml(default),json
Item: servers (ScreenScraper server information)

Returned Elements:
cpu1 : % of server 1 CPU utilization (average of the last 5 minutes)
cpu2: % of server 2 CPU utilization (average of the last 5 minutes)
CPU3: % of server 3 CPU utilization (average of the last 5 minutes)
threadsmin: Number of accesses to the API since the last minute
nbscrapers: Number of scrapers using the api since the last minute
apiacces : Number of accesses to the API in the current day (GMT+1)

Status
closefornomember : API closed for anonymous (not registered or unidentified) (0 : open / 1 : closed)
closeforleecher : API closed for non-participating members (no proposal validated) (0 : open / 1 : closed)

Quota
maxthreadfornonmember : Maximum number of threads opened for anonymous (unregistered or unidentified) at the same time by the threadfornonmember API
: Current number of threads opened by anonymous (unregistered or unidentified) at the same time by the maxthreadformember API
: Maximum number of threads opened for members at the same time by the threadformember API
: The current number of threads opened by members at the same time by the Example Call
API
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/ssinfraInfos.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&output=xml
ssuserInfos.php: ScreenScraper User Information
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your developer
password softname: name of the software calling
output: xml(default),json
ssid: user's
ScreenScraper ID sspassword: User's
ScreenScraper password Item: ssuser (ScreenScraper user information)

Returned Items:
id: user's nickname on ScreenScraper
numid: user's numeric identifier on ScreenScraper
level: user's level on ScreenScraper
contribution : level of financial contribution on ScreenScraper (2 = 1 Additional Thread / 3 and + = 5 Additional Threads)
uploadsysteme: Counter of valid contributions (system media) proposed by the user
uploadinfos: Counter of valid contributions (text info) proposed by the user
romasso: Counter of valid contributions (association of roms) proposed by the user
uploadmedia: Counter of valid contributions (game media) proposed by the user
proposalok: Number of user proposals validated by a moderator
propositionko: Number of user proposals rejected by a moderator
quotarefu : Percentage of rejection of the user's

proposal Threads
maxthreads : Number of threads allowed for the user (also indicated for non-registrants)
maxdownloadspeed: Download speed (in KB/s) allowed for the user (also indicated for non-registrants)

Quotas
requeststoday: Total number of calls to the API during the day in short
requestskotoday : Number of calls to the API with a negative return (rom/set not found) during the day in short
maxrequestspermin: Number of calls to the maximum allowed API per minute for the user (see F.A.Q.)
maxrequestsperday: The maximum number of API calls allowed per day for the user (see F.A.Q.)
maxrequestskoperday: Maximum number of API calls with negative feedback (rom/set not found) allowed per day for the user (see F.A.Q.)

visits: number of visits by the user to ScreenScraper
datelastvisit: date of the user's last visit to ScreenScraper (format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss)
favregion: preferred region of the user's visits to ScreenScraper (france,europe,usa,japan)
Example call
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/ssuserInfos.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&output=xml&ssid=&sspassword=
userlevelsListe.php: List of ScreenScraper User Levels
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your developer
password softname: name of the software calling
output: xml(default),json
ssid(not required): user
ScreenScraper ID sspassword(not required): User
ScreenScraper password Items: userlevels

Elements Returned:
userlevel (xml) / id (json) {
id: numeric identifier of the level
nom_fr: name of the level in English
}

https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/userlevelsListe.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&output=xml&ssid=test&sspassword=test

name: Designation of the number of players
parent: numeric identifier of the number of players parent (0 if no parent)

genresListe.php: List of genera
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your developer
password softname: name of the software calling
output: xml(default),json
ssid(not required): user
ScreenScraper ID sspassword(not required): User
ScreenScraper password Items: genera

Elements Returned:
genus (xml) / id (json) {
id: numeric
genus identifier nom_de: genus name in German
nom_en: genus name in English
nom_es: genus name in Spanish
nom_fr: genus name in French
nom_it: name of the genre in Italian
nom_pt: name of the genre in Portuguese
parent: id of the parent genre (0 if main genre)
media {
media_pictomonochrome: media download url: Pictogram Monochrome
media_pictomonochromesvg: media download url: Pictogram Monochrome Vector
media_pictocouleur: media download url: Pictogram Color
media_pictocouleursvg: media download url: Pictogram Vector Color
media_background: media download url: Wallpaper
}
}
Example call
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/genresListe.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&output=xml&ssid=test&sspassword=test

media {
media_pictomonochrome: media download url: Pictogram Monochrome

pictogram: Media download url: Vector
color pictogram media_background: Media download url: media_figurine wallpaper
: Media download url: Figurine
}
}
Example of a https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/famillesListe.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&output=xml&ssid=test&sspassword=test call

language (xml) / id (json) {
id: numeric identifier of the language
shortname: short name of the language
nom_de: name of the language in German
nom_en: name of the language in English
nom_es : language name in Spanish
nom_fr : language name in English
nom_it : language name in Italian
nom_pt : language name in Portuguese
parent : parent language id (0 if main gender)
media {
media_pictomonochrome : media download url : Pictogram Monochrome
media_pictomonochromesvg : media download url : Monochrome Vector
Pictogram media_pictocouleur : media download url : Pictogram Color
media_pictocouleursvg : media download url : Vector
color pictogram media_background : media download url : Wallpaper
}
}
Example call
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/languesListe.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&output=xml&ssid=test&sspassword=test
classificationsListe.php: List of Ratings (Game Rating)
Input parameters:

ID devpassword: your developer

shortname: short name of the classification

nom_en : name of the classification in English (if existing)
nom_es: name of the classification in Spanish (if existing)
nom_fr: name of the classification in French (if existing)
nom_it: name of the classification in Italian (if existing)
nom_pt: name of the classification in Portuguese (if existing)
parent: id of the parent classification (0 if main gender)

media_pictomonochrome: media download url: Monochrome
pictogram media_pictomonochromesvg: media download url: Monochrome Vector
pictogram media_pictocouleur: media download url: media_pictocouleursvg color
pictogram: media download url: Vector
color pictogrammedia_background: Media download url: Wallpaper
}

mediasSystemeListe.php: Media List for Systems
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your developer
password softname: name of the software calling
output: xml(default),json
ssid(not required): user
ScreenScraper ID sspassword(not required): User
ScreenScraper password Items: Media

Elements Returned:
media (xml) / id (json) {
id: numeric identifier of the media
shortname: short name of the media
name: long name of the media
category: category of the media
platformstypes : list of system types where media is present (id of system type separated by | , if empty = all system types)
platforms: list of systems where media is present (id of system type separated by | , if empty = all systems)
type: media
type fileformat: file format of media
fileformat2: 2nd media file format accepted to the autogen proposal
: auto-generated media (0=no,1=yes)
multi-regions: multi-region media (0=no,1=yes)
multi-media: multi-media (0=no,1=yes)
multi-versions: multi-version media (0=no,1=yes)
extrainfostxt: additional media
information }

mediaGroup.php: Downloading Media Images of Game Groups
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your developer
password softname: name of the calling
software ssid(not required): ScreenScraper ID of the user
sspassword(not mandatory): ScreenScraper password of the user
crc: crc calculation of the existing image locally
MD5: Calculation MD5 of the existing image in local
SHA1: SHA1 calculation of the existing image in local
GroupID: Numeric identifier of the groups (see genreListe.php, modeListe.php,... / type of groups = Genre, mode, family, theme, style)
Media: Text identifier of the media to be returned (see genreListe.php, modeListe.php,... / Type of groups = Genre, mode, family, theme, style)
mediaformat(not mandatory): format (extension) of the media: e.g. jpg, png, mp4, zip, mp3, ... (informative data: does not return the media in the specified format)
Output Parameters:
maxwidth(not required): Maximum width in pixels of the returned
image maxheight(not required): Maximum height in pixels of the returned
image outputformat(not required): Format (extension) of the returned image: png or jpg
Element Returned: PNG image
or
CRCOK or MD5OK or SHA1OK text if the crc, md5 or sha1 parameter is the same as the crc, md5 or sha1 calculation of the server image (update optimization)
or
NOMEDIA text if the media file was not found
Example call
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/mediaGroup.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&ssid=test&sspassword=test&crc=&md5=&sha1=&groupid=1&media=logo-monochrome
mediaCompagnie.php: Download Media Images of Gaming Companies
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your developer
password softname: name of the calling
software ssid(not required): ScreenScraper ID of the user
sspassword(not mandatory): ScreenScraper password of the user
crc: crc calculation of the existing image locally
MD5: MD5 Calculation of the Existing Image in Local
SHA1: SHA1 Calculation of the Existing Image in Local
CompanyID: Digital Identifier of the Media Company
: Text ID of the Media to be Returned
MediaFormat(Not Mandatory): Format (extension) of the Media: e.g. jpg, png, mp4, zip, mp3, ... (informative data: does not return the media in the specified format)
Output Parameters:
maxwidth(not required): Maximum width in pixels of the returned
image maxheight(not required): Maximum height in pixels of the returned
image outputformat(not required): Format (extension) of the returned image: png or jpg
Element Returned: PNG image
or
CRCOK or MD5OK or SHA1OK text if the crc, md5 or sha1 parameter is the same as the crc, md5 or sha1 calculation of the server image (update optimization)
or
NOMEDIA text if the media file was not found
Example call
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/mediaCompagnie.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&ssid=test&sspassword=test&crc=&md5=&sha1=&companyid=3&media=logo-monochrome
systemesListe.php: List of systems / system information / system media information
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your developer
password softname: name of the software calling
output: xml(default),json
ssid(not required): user
ScreenScraper ID sspassword(not required): User
ScreenScraper password Item: ssuser (ScreenScraper user information)

Returned Items:
id: user's nickname on ScreenScraper
level: user's level on ScreenScraper
contribution: level of financial contribution on ScreenScraper (2 = 1 Additional Thread/3 and + = 5 Additional Threads)
uploadsysteme : User-Proposed
Valid Contribution Counter (System Media) uploadinfos: User-Proposed Valid Contributions Counter (Text Info)
romasso: User-Proposed
Valid Contributions Counter (Rom Association) uploadmedia: User-Proposed Valid Contributions (Game Media)
Counter Maxthreads : Number of threads allowed for the user (also indicated for non-registrants)
maxdownloadspeed: Download speed (in KB/s) allowed for the user (also indicated for non-registrants)
requeststoday: Number of API calls during the current
day requestskotoday: Number of API calls with a negative return (rom/game not found) during the current
daymaxrequestsperdmin: The maximum number of API calls allowed per minute for the user (see F.A.Q.)
maxrequestsperday: The maximum number of API calls allowed per day for the user (see F.A.Q.)
maxrequestskoperday: Maximum number of API calls with negative feedback (rom/set not found) allowed per day for the user (see F.A.Q.)
visits: number of visits by the user to ScreenScraper
datelastvisit: date of the user's last visit to ScreenScraper (format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss)
favregion: preferred region of the user's visits to ScreenScraper (france,europe,usa,japan)
Items: system (xml) / systems (json)

Elements Returned:
id: numeric identifier of the system (to be resupplied in other API requests)
parentid: numeric identifier of the parent
system names {
nom_xx: Name of the system Region xx (xx = variable "shortname" of the API regionsListe.php)
...
nom_recalbox: System name in the Recalbox
frontend nom_retropie: System name in the Retropie
frontend nom_launchbox: Name of the system in the front-end Launchbox
nom_hyperspin: Name of the system in the front-end Hyperspin
noms_commun: Common names given to the system in general
}
extensions: Extensions of the files of usable roms (all emulators combined)
company: Name of the production company of the typical system
: System type (Arcade,Console,Handheld Console,Arcade Emulation,Flipper,Online,Computer,Smartphone)
start date: Production start
year end date: Production end
year romtype: Rom type(s) (see romTypesList query)
supporttype: Type of the original media of the system (see supportTypesList query)
media

media_logomonochrome_xx_md5 : MD5 ID of the media file (allows you to check if the online media is the same as local before downloading it)
media_logomonochrome_xx_sha1: sha1 ID of the media file (allows you to check if the online media is the same as the local one before downloading it)

mediaSysteme.php: Downloading image media from systems
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your developer
password softname: name of the calling
software ssid(not required): ScreenScraper ID of the user
sspassword(not mandatory): ScreenScraper password of the user
crc: crc calculation of the existing image locally
MD5: Calculation MD5 of the existing image in local
SHA1: Calculation SHA1 of the existing image in local
SystemEID: Numeric identifier of the system (see systemesListe.php)
Media: Text identifier of the media to be returned (see systemesListe.php)
Mediaformat(not mandatory): format (extension) of the media: e.g. jpg, png, mp4, zip, mp3, ... (informative data: does not return the media in the specified format)
Output Parameters:
maxwidth(not required): Maximum width in pixels of the returned
image maxheight(not required): Maximum height in pixels of the returned
image outputformat(not required): Format (extension) of the returned image: png or jpg
Element Returned: PNG image
or
CRCOK or MD5OK or SHA1OK text if the crc, md5 or sha1 parameter is the same as the crc, md5 or sha1 calculation of the server image (update optimization)
or
NOMEDIA text if the media file was not found
Example call
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/mediaSysteme.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&ssid=test&sspassword=test&crc=&md5=&sha1=&systemeid=1&media=wheel(wor)
mediaVideoSysteme.php: Downloading video media from systems
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your developer
password softname: name of the calling
software ssid(not required): ScreenScraper ID of the user
sspassword(not mandatory): ScreenScraper password of the user
crc: crc calculation of the existing video locally
MD5: Calculation MD5 of the existing video in local
SHA1: Calculation SHA1 of the existing video in local
SystemID: Numeric identifier of the system (see systemesListe.php)
Media: Text identifier of the media to be returned (see systemesListe.php)
Mediaformat : format (extension) of the media: e.g. jpg, png, mp4, zip, mp3, ... (not required, informative data: does not return the media in the specified format)
Returned Element: Video MP4
or
Text CRCOK or MD5OK or SHA1OK if the crc, md5 or sha1 parameter is the same as the crc, md5 or sha1 calculation of the server video (optimization of updates)
or
NOMEDIA Text if the media file was not found

Example call
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/mediaVideoSysteme.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&ssid=test&sspassword=test&crc=&md5=&sha1=&systemeid=1&media=video
jeuRecherche.php: Search for a game with its name (returns a table of games (limited to 30 games) ranked by probability)
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your softname developer
password: name of the software calling
output: xml(default),json
ssid(not required): ScreenScraper ID of user
sspassword(not mandatory): ScreenScraper password of user
systemeid(not required): numeric system identifier (see systemesListe.php)
search: name of the game searched
Item: servers (ScreenScraper server information)

Items Returned:
servercpu1: % of CPUs on the current
main server servercpu2 : % of users CPUs on the current
secondary server threadsmin: number of accesses to the API since the last 60 seconds
nbscrapers: number of API users currently
apiacces: number of accesses to the API today (French time)
Item: ssuser (ScreenScraper user information)

Returned Items:
id: user's nickname on ScreenScraper
level: user's level on ScreenScraper
contribution: level of financial contribution on ScreenScraper (2 = 1 Additional Thread/3 and + = 5 Additional Threads)
uploadsysteme: Counter of valid contributions (system media) proposed by the user
uploadinfo : User-Proposed
Valid Contribution Counter (Text Info) romasso: User-Proposed
Valid Contribution Counter (ROM Association) uploadmedia: User-Proposed
Valid Contribution Counter (Game Media) maxthreads: Number of threads allowed for the user (also indicated for non-registrants)
maxdownloadspeed : Authorized download speed (in KB/s) for the user (also indicated for non-subscribers)
requeststoday: Number of calls to the API during the day in short
requestskotoday: Number of calls to the API with a negative return (rom/set not found) during the day in short
maxrequestsperdmin: Number of calls to the API allowed per minute for the user (see F.A.Q.)
maxrequestsperday: The maximum number of API calls allowed per day for the user (see F.A.Q.)
maxrequestskoperday: Maximum number of API calls with negative feedback (rom/set not found) allowed per day for the user (see F.A.Q.)
visits: number of visits the user to ScreenScraper
datelastvisit: date of the user's last visit to ScreenScraper (format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss)
favregion: vi's favorite regionuser's sites on ScreenScraper (france,europe,usa,japan)
XML item: games (table) then game
JSON item: games (table)

Returned elements:
Same as the game APIINFO

but without the rom info Example call
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/jeuRecherche.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&output=xml&ssid=test&sspassword=test&systemeid=1&recherche=sonic
jeuInfos.php: Game Information / Game Media
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your softname developer
password: name of the software calling
output: xml(default),json
ssid(not required): user ScreenScraper
ID sspassword(not required): User ScreenScraper
password crc*: CRC calculation of the ROM/ISO/folder file existing locally
MD5*: MD5 calculation of the ROM/ISO/folder file existing locally
SHA1*: SHA1 calculation of the ROM1*: SHA1 calculation of the ROMx1 file/folder existing locally
Systemeid: numeric identifier of the system (see systemesListe.php)
ROMtype: Type of "rom": single ROM file / unique ISO file / ROMnest folder
: file name (with extension) or rom folder
namesize*: Byte size of the serialnum file or folder
: Force search for the game with the associated
rom serial number (iso) gameid**: Force search for the game with its numeric
ID* unless there is a derogation, you must send at least one (the best would be the 3) of these calculations (crc,md5,sha1) to identify a rom/iso file or folder with your request AND the size (we octect the file or folder).
** No rom information is sent in this case.
Item: Servers (ScreenScraper server information)

Items Returned:
servercpu1: % of CPUs on the current
primary server servercpu2: % of CPUs on the current
secondary server threadsmin: Number of API accesses in the last 60 seconds
nbscrapers : number of API users currently
apiacces: number of API accesses today (French time)
Item: ssuser (ScreenScraper user information)

Returned Elements:
id: user's nickname on ScreenScraper
level: user's level on ScreenScraper
contribution: level of financial contribution on ScreenScraper (2 = 1 Additional Thread/3 and + = 5 Additional Threads)
uploadsysteme: Counter of valid contributions (system media) proposed by the user
uploadinfo: Counter of valid contributions (text info) proposed by the user
romasso : User-Proposed
Valid Contributions (ROM Association) Counter uploadmedia: User-Proposed
Valid Contributions (Game Media) Counter maxthreads: Number of threads allowed for the user (also indicated for non-registrants)
maxdownloadspeed: Allowed download speed (in KB/s)e for the user (also indicated for non-registrants)
requeststoday: Number of calls to the API during the day in short
requestskotoday: Number of calls to the API with a negative return (rom/set not found) during the day in short
maxrequestsperdmin: Number of maximum API calls allowed per minute for the user (see F.A.Q.)
maxrequestsperday: The maximum number of API calls allowed per day for the user (see F.A.Q.)
maxrequestskoperday: Maximum number of API calls with negative feedback (rom/set not found) allowed per day for the user (see F.A.Q.)
visits: number of visits by the user on ScreenScraper
datelastvisit: date of the user's last visit on ScreenScraper (format: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss)
favregion: favorite region of the user's visits on ScreenScraper (france,europe,usa,japan)
Item: game

Returned Elements:
id: numeric identifier of the game
ROVID: numeric identifier of the ROM
notgame: (true/false) indicates whether the ROM is assigned to a game or to a NON game (demo/app/...)
name: Game name (internal ScreenScraper)
names {
nom_ss: Game name (internal ScreenScraper)
nom_xx: Game title region xx (xx = API "courtname" variable regionsListe.php)
...

}

roms [ List of known roms associated with the game
rom (xml) / romid (json) {
id: numeric identifier of the rom
romnumsupport: support number (e.g. 1 = floppy disk 01 or CD 01)
romtotalsupport: total number of media (e.g. 2 = 2 floppy disks or 2 CDs)
romfilename : name of the ROM file or ROMsize folder
: size in octect of the ROM file or size of the contents of the ROMCRC folder
: result of the CRC32 calculation of the ROM file or the largest file in the ROMd5 "ROM"
folder: result of the MD5 calculation of the ROM file or the largest file in the ROMSA1 "ROM"
folder : result of the SHA1 calculation of the rom file or the largest file in the "rom"
folder romcloneof: numeric identifier of the parent rom if the rom is a clone (Arcade Systems)
beta: Beta version of the game (0=no / 1=yes)
demo: Demo version of the game (0=no / 1=yes)
translated: Translated version of the game (0=no / 1=yes)
hack : Modified Version of the game (0=no / 1=yes)
unl : Game not "Official" (0 =no / 1=yes)
alt : Alternative version of the game (0=no / 1=yes)
best : Best Version of the game (0=no / 1=yes)
netplay: Netplay compatible (0=no / 1=yes)
]

rom { Information about the scraped rom (if found in the database)
rom (xml) / romid (json) {
id: numeric identifier of the rom
romnumsupport: media number (e.g. 1 = floppy disk 01 or CD 01)
romtotalsupport: total number of media (e.g. 2 = 2 floppy disks or 2 CDs)
romfilename: name of the rom file or romserial folder
: Manufacturer's
serial number ROMregions: Region(s) of the ROM or folder (e.g.: "fr,us,sp")
romLanguages: Language(s) of the ROM or folder (e.g.: "FR,EN,ES" )
ROMtype: ROMsupportType
type: ROMssize
media type: Size in OCTECT of the ROM file or size of the contents of the ROMCRC folder
: result of the CRC32 calculation of the rom file or the largest file in the "rom"
folder rommd5: result of the MD5 calculation of the rom file or the largest file in the "rom"
folder romsha1: result of the SHA1 calculation of the rom file or the largest file in the "rom"
folder romcloneof: numeric identifier of the parent ROM if the ROM is a clone (Arcade Systems)
beta : Beta version of the game (0=no / 1=yes)
demo: Demo version of the game (0=no / 1=yes)
translated: Translated version of the game (0=no / 1=yes)
hack: Modified version of the game (0=no / 1=yes)
unl: Game not "Official" (0=no / 1=yes)
alt: Alternative version of the game (0=no / 1=yes)
best: Best Version of the game (0=no / 1=yes)
netplay: Netplay compatible (0=no / 1=yes)
players : Number of players specific to the rom (if different from the "original" game)
dates {
text id region (france=date_fr,europe=date_eu,usa=date_us,japan=date_jp,...): Release date specific to the rom (if different from the "original" game) in the region indicated
}
publisher: Name of the publisher specific to the rom (if different from the "original" game)
developer : Name of the developer specific to the rom (if different from the "original" game)
synopsis {
synopsis_xx: Description specific to the rom (if different from the "original" game) in language xx (xx = variable "shortname" of the API languesListe.php)
...

} clonetypes {
clonetypes_id: numeric identifier of the clone
type clonetypes_xx: designation of the hack type region xx (xx = API "courtname" variable regionsListe.php)
...

} hacktypes {
hacktypes_id : numeric identifier of the hack
type hacktypes_xx : designation of the hack type region xx (xx = variable "shortname" of the API regionsListe.php)
...
}
}
} Example

call
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/jeuInfos.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&output=xml&ssid=test&sspassword=test&crc=50ABC90A&systemeid=1&romtype=rom&romnom=Sonic%20The%20Hedgehog%202%20(World).zip&romtaille=749652
mediaJeu.php: Downloading media images from games
Input parameters:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your softname developer
password: name of the calling
software ssid(not required): ScreenScraper ID of the user
sspassword(not mandatory): ScreenScraper password of the user
crc: crc calculation of the existing image locally
MD5: Calculation MD5 of the existing image locally
SHA1: SHA1 calculation of the existing image locally
Systemeid: Numeric identifier of the system (see systemesListe.php)
jeuID: Numeric identifier of the set (see jeuInfos.php)
Media: Text identifier of the media to be returned (see jeuInfos.php)
Mediaformat(not mandatory): format (extension) of the media: e.g. jpg, png, mp4, zip, mp3, ... (informative data: does not return the media in the specified format)
Output Parameters:
maxwidth(not required): Maximum width in pixels of the returned
image maxheight(not required): Maximum pixel height of the returned
image outputformat(not required): Format (extract) of the returned image: png or jpg
Returned Element: PNG image
or
CRCOK or MD5OK or SHA1OK text if the crc, md5 or sha1 parameter is the same as the crc, md5 or sha1 calculation of the server image (update optimization)
or
NOMEDIA text if the media file was not found
Example call
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/mediaJeu.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&ssid=test&sspassword=test&crc=&md5=&sha1=&systemeid=1&jeuid=3&media=wheel-hd(wor)
mediaVideoJeu.php: Downloading video media from games
Settings:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your developer
password softname: name of the calling
software ssid: user's ScreenScraper ID (optional)
sspassword: User's ScreenScraper password (optional)
crc: crc calculation of the existing video locally
md5 : MD5 Calculation of Existing Video in Local
SHA1: SHA1 Calculation of Existing Video in Local
SystemID: Numeric System Identifier (see systemesListe.php)
JEUID: Numeric System Identifier (see jeuInfos.php)
Media: Text ID of the media to be returned (see jeuInfos.php)
Mediaformat : format (extension) of the media: e.g. jpg, png, mp4, zip, mp3, ... (not required, informative data: does not return the media in the specified format)
Returned Element: Video MP4
or
Text CRCOK or MD5OK or SHA1OK if the crc, md5 or sha1 parameter is the same as the crc, md5 or sha1 calculation of the server video (optimization of updates)
or
NOMEDIA Text if the media file was not found
Example call
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/mediaVideoJeu.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&ssid=test&sspassword=test&crc=&md5=&sha1=&systemeid=1&jeuid=3&media=video
mediaManuelJeu.php: Downloading Game Manuals
Settings:
devid: your developer
ID devpassword: your developer
password softname: name of the calling
software ssid: user's ScreenScraper ID (optional)
sspassword: User's ScreenScraper password (optional)
CRC: crc calculation of the existing manual file locally md5
: MD5 calculation of the existing manual file in local
SHA1: SHA1 calculation of the existing manual file in local
systemeid: numeric identifier of the system (see systemesListe.php)
jeuid: numeric identifier of the system (see jeuInfos.php)
media: text identifier of the media to be returned (see jeuInfos.php)
mediaformat : format (extension) of the media: e.g. jpg, png, mp4, zip, mp3, pdf, ... (not required, informative data: does not return the media in the specified format)
Returned Item: PDF
Manual or
Text CRCOK or MD5OK or SHA1OK if the crc, md5 or sha1 parameter is the same as the crc, md5 or sha1 calculation of the server video (update optimization)
or
NOMEDIA text if the media file was not found
Example call
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/mediaManuelJeu.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&ssid=test&sspassword=test&crc=&md5=&sha1=&systemeid=1&jeuid=3&media=manuel(eu)

botNote.php: System for automating the sending of a game note from a ScreenScraper member
The request must be sent as an html request with the "GET" method.

Settings:
SSID: (type "text") User
ScreenScraper ID sspassword: (type "text") User
ScreenScraper password gameid: (type "text") Numeric game ID on ScreenScraper
note: (type "integer from 1 to 20") Game Score out of 20

Returned Element:
Returns textual information about the proper or malfunction of the procedure
Example of an appeal
https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/botNote.php?devid=xxx&devpassword=yyy&softname=zzz&ssid=test&sspassword=test&gameid=3&note=18

botProposition.php: System for automating the sending of news or media proposals to ScreenScraper
The request must be sent in the form of an html form of type "multipart/form-data" with the "POST" method.

Input parameters:
ssid: (type "text") user's
ScreenScraper ID sspassword: (type "text") User's
ScreenScraper password gameid: (type "text") numeric game ID on ScreenScraper
or
romid: (type "text") numeric identifier of the rom on ScreenScraper

To propose a textual info:
modiftypeinfo: (type "text") type of info sent (see "modiftypeinfo" list)
modifregion: (type "text") short name of the region of the information (optional: see list "modiftypeinfo" / list of regions "regionsListe.php")
modificationlanguage: (type "text") short name of the language of the information (optional: see list "modiftypeinfo" / list of regions "languesListe.php")
modificationversion: (type "text") version of the information (optional: see list "modiftypeinfo")
modificationtext: (type "text") Information itself
modificationsource: (type "text") (optional) Source (url of the web page, scan of the original medium, author, ...) of the information

Example of an html form:


To propose a media:
modiftypemedia: (type "text") type of media sent (see list "modiftypemedia")
modifmediafile: (type "file") File (File format: see list "modiftypemedia")
modifmediafileurl: (type "text") url of the media to be downloaded (File format: see list "modiftypemedia")
modiftyperegion : (type "text") short name of the region of the information (optional: see list "modiftypemedia" / list of regions "regionsListe.php")
modiftypenumsupport: (type "text") support number (optional: see list "modiftypemedia" / number from 0 to 10)
modiftypeversion: (type "text") version of the information (optional: see list "modiftypemedia")
modifmediasource : (type "text") (optional) Source (url of the web page, scan of the original medium, author, ...) of the information

Returned Elements:
Returns textual information on the proper or bad functioning of the procedure <html>
  <head>
  <META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8"> 
  <META http-equiv="content-language" content="fr"> 
  <title></title>
  </head> 
  <body> 
    <form name="myform" id="myform" method="post" enctype="multipart/form-data" action="https://api.screenscraper.fr/api2/botProposition.php?ssid=xxx&sspassword=yyy"> 
      <input type="text" name="gameid" value="3"> 
      <input type="text" name="modiftypeinfo" value="description">
      <input type="text" name="modifregion" value="">   
      <input type="text" name="modiflangue" value="fr"> 
      <input type="text" name="modifversion" value=""> 
      <input type="text" name="modiftexte" value="ici, le synopsis du jeu ! ne pas valider, c'est un test ;)"> 
      <input type="text" name="modifsource" value="botProposition / source de l'info">
      <input type="submit" value="envoyer"> 
    </form>
      
  <script> 
    document.getElementById("myform").submit();
    </script>
         
  </body>
</html> 
List of text info types for games (modiftypeinfo)
Type Designation Region Tongue Multiple Choice Format
name Game Name (by Region) obligatory Text
Publisher Publisher Text
Developer Developer Text
players Number of Player(s) Group name (see groups)
score Note Score out of 20 from 0 to 20
Rating Classification Yes Group name (see groups)
Kinds Genre(s) Yes French name of the group (see groups)
datesrelease Release Date(s) obligatory Format: yyyy-mm-dd ("xxxx-01-01" if year only)
rotation Rotation 0 to 360
Resolution Resolution Text: Width x height in pixels (e.g. 320x240)
Modes Game Mode(s) Yes Text
Families Family(s) Yes Family name (e.g. "Sonic" for "Sonic 3D pinball")
Number Number Yes Series Name + Number in the series (e.g. "sonic the Hedgehog 2")
Styles Style(s) Yes Text: Graphic style
Themes Theme(s) Text: Game theme (e.g. "Vampire")
description Synopsis obligatory Text
